Package game_world

Class Grid

java.lang.Object
game_world.Grid
public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
A class of the Grid, containing the cells for the gameworld to use. Each Grid has a width, height and a matrix of cells.
Version:
3.0
Author:
Andreas Awouters Thomas Van Erum Dirk Vanbeveren Geert Wesemael

      width - The width for this new Grid.

    • Grid

      protected Grid​(int height, int width, game_world.api.Vector[] locations, Cell[] cells) throws java.lang.Exception
      Initialize a new Grid with given width and height. set given cells in Grid at given locations all other cells are empty.
      Parameters:
      height - The height for this new Grid.
      width - The width for this new Grid.
      locations - The list of locations associated with the given cells.
      cells - The list of cells with associated locations.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

      protected Grid()
      Create a default empty 5x5 Grid with the goal at (4,4).

  • Method Details

    • randomGrid

      protected static Grid randomGrid​(int width, int height)
      Return a new Grid with given width and height. Some cells are empty or a wall. One cell in the Grid is a Goal.
      Parameters:
      height - The height for this new Grid.
      width - The width for this new Grid.
      Returns:
      a new Grid with random cells

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      The width of the Grid.
      Returns:
      width of the Grid.

    • getHeight

      public int getHeight()
      The height of the Grid.
      Returns:
      height of the Grid.

    • setCell

      protected void setCell​(game_world.api.Vector location, Cell cell) throws OutOfBoundsException
      Set the given cell at a given location.
      Parameters:
      location - The location in the Grid where the cell should be set.
      cell - The cell to be placed in a given location.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - The given location is out of the Grid.
      OutOfBoundsException

    • setCells

      protected void setCells​(game_world.api.Vector[] locations, Cell[] cells) throws java.lang.Exception
      Set the given cells at given locations.
      Parameters:
      locations - The list of locations in the Grid where the associated cells should be set.
      cells - The cells to be placed at the associated locations.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - One of the given locations is out of the Grid.

    • getCell

      protected Cell getCell​(game_world.api.Vector location) throws OutOfBoundsException
      The cell at given location.
      Parameters:
      location - The location of the requested cell.
      Returns:
      the cell at given location | result = getCell(location.getX(),location.getY())
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - The given vector lies out of the Grid.
      OutOfBoundsException

    • getCell

      public Cell getCell​(int x, int y) throws OutOfBoundsException
      The cell at given x,y coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - The x coordinate of the vector.
      y - The y coordinate of the vector.
      Returns:
      the cell at given x,y coordinates | result = getCell(x,y)
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - The given x and y values don't lie inside of the Grid.
      OutOfBoundsException

    • isInBounds

      protected boolean isInBounds​(game_world.api.Vector location)
      Checks if the given location is in the boundaries of the Grid.
      Parameters:
      location - The given location to check.
      Returns:
      true if the location isInBounds() | result = isInBounds(location.getX(), location.getY())

    • isInBounds

      protected boolean isInBounds​(int x, int y)
      Check if the given x,y coordinates are in boundaries of the Grid.
      Parameters:
      x - The given x coordinate to check.
      y - The given y coordinate to check.
      Returns:
      false if x is lower than 0 or bigger then or equal to width of the Grid. false if y is lower than 0 or bigger then or equal to height of the Grid. otherwise return true. | result = !((x < 0 || x >= getWidth()) && (y < 0 || y >= getHeight()))

    • setEdgesToWall

      public void setEdgesToWall()
      Set all cells at the border of the Grid to Walls.

    • createCopy

      public Grid createCopy()
